Posted By: NeverendingDream (7/13/2010 5:19:20 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I run it in a mono-white EDH deck currently. Not as the general, though. Her ability is really useful for draining off that last bit of mana before the start of your turn. Two life here, 4 life there, it all starts to add up. Once you get a large enough mana pool, she really becomes a threat, and people will waste removal on her, instead of something more important. Also, with [Boon Reflection](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Boon Reflection) in play, you get more bang for your buck, as it were.  
  
Outside of an EDH/multiplayer environment, I most certainly would use something else.
posts.html:

Outside of an EDH/multiplayer environment, I most certainly would use something else.

Posted By: SavageBrain89 (6/13/2009 4:01:07 PM)

posts.post_content:
If you are just up for lifegain in a Cleric deck, use either [Oracle of Nectars](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Oracle of Nectars) or [Ancestor's Prophet](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ancestor's Prophet) instead.  
If you are just up for protecting creatures, use [Oriss, Samite Guardian](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Oriss, Samite Guardian).  
When you're looking for damage prevention, use [Orim, Samite Healer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Orim, Samite Healer) [Master Healer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Master Healer) or instead.  
Paying five mana for a 2/3 body with a restricted and somewhat expensive ability doesn't sound that great even in a Cleric tribal deck. I remember a friend of mine putting her into a five-color casual deck... >)
posts.html:

If you are just up for protecting creatures, use Oriss, Samite Guardian.
When you're looking for damage prevention, use Orim, Samite Healer Master Healer or instead.
Paying five mana for a 2/3 body with a restricted and somewhat expensive ability doesn't sound that great even in a Cleric tribal deck. I remember a friend of mine putting her into a five-color casual deck... >)
